intro: Cyrtandra lobbii, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the island of Molokaʻi in Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy. Cyrtandra lobbii thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. It is a rare and endangered species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its habitat.
